title: Labor Standards Complaint Forms (LS223) filed on employers in Delaware County

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Labor Standards Complaint Forms (LS223) filed on employers in Delaware County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all Labor Standards Complaint Forms (LS223) filed by employees of businesses located in Delaware County, NY, since 1996, including companies owned and operated by parent companies in other regions of the United States and the world with facilities in Delaware County. Additionally, I would like to request any and all records pertaining to Task Force Hotline reports of lack of safety equipment, retaliation, forced labor, or other issues filed via telephone by employees of companies located in Delaware County, NY, since 1996.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anne Elizabeth Moore

title: Water Quality Complaints in Delaware County, NY

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Delaware County, NY
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of records related to water quality complaints and issues within the Village of Hobart in the Town of Stamford in Delaware County for the period from January 1, 1996, to the present.

Specifically, I am seeking the following information:

1) The total number of water quality complaints received by your agency/authority/utility, broken down by year.

2) A detailed summary of each water quality complaint, including:
2a. The date of the complaint
2b. The location (address or nearest cross streets) of the complaint
2c. The nature of the complaint (e.g., odor, taste, discoloration, contamination concerns)
2d. Any actions taken by your agency/authority/utility to address the complaint
2e. The resolution or current status of the complaint

3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

If any of this information is available in electronic format, I kindly request that you provide it via email. If physical copies are necessary, please inform me of any copying or postage fees in advance, and I will make arrangements for payment.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a detailed explanation for the denial and inform me of any appeal procedures available under New York State law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anne Elizabeth Moore

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: JSPG covert action planning
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am looking for files on the groups planning unconventional and psychological warfare in the Joint Strategic  Planning Group during the cold war.

I would like any files from a keyword on JSPG file of an "Orange Team", "Brown Team", "strategic deception", or "special plans", in the years 1946-1973. My understanding is that Orange Team handled strategic deception planning and Brown Team handled unconventional warfare.

Thanks,
Brian

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Mills

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Porter Funeral Home Investigative File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

ISP's investigative file for the former Porter Funeral Home located at 726 E. North Street, Tipton, Tipton County, specifically the discovery of abandoned human remains and cremains in June 2019. I understand investigatory records of law enforcement agencies may be exempt from disclosure under IC 5-14-3-4(b). However, the investigation occurred five years ago and no longer appears to be active. The owner of the former funeral home is deceased; he died shortly before the ISP began their investigation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Caitlin Downey

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: John Francis Lansing (July 31, 1957 – August 14, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into former National Public Radio and U.S. Agency for Global Media chief John Francis Lansing (July 31, 1957 – August 14, 2024). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/08/23/business/media/john-lansing-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: USAID Disaster Assistance Relief Team reports on Gaza

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USAID Disaster Assistance Relief Team reports on Gaza
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports from the USAID Disaster Assistance Relief Team to the U.S. State Department about the humanitarian situation in Gaza, between 6 May 2024 and the date this request is processed.

The news site KlipNews shared parts of a 28 August 2024 cable titled, "Gaza: IDF Evacuation Orders Repeatedly Displace Civilians and Aid Workers, Squeezing Limited Remaining Humanitarian Space." I am requesting this cable and others with the same subject matter. You may find the cable shared by KlipNews attached below or at the following link:  https://www.kenklippenstein.com/p/leaked-gaza-cable-us-military-in

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: FOIA Request: Karl Hess (Internal Revenue Service)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request: Karl Hess (Internal Revenue Service)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- All records, including cross-referenced files and ELSUR documents, mentioning Karl Hess (1923-1994), a journalist, speechwriter, and political activist. Proof of death is not required, as his death has been widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/1994/04/27/obituaries/karl-hess-a-republican-aide-who-became-an-anarchist-70.html.

As I mentioned, I'm requesting a search for cross-referenced documents as well as the subject's main file, should it exist.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jesse Walker

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: INS/Inscape Seattle Landmarks Preservation Board commentary emails sent to sarah.sodt@seattle.gov
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Emails sent and received by the Sarah Sodt's email address of Sarah.sodt@seattle.gov related to deliberations on nominating the INS Building (aka "Inscape building") for landmark status. Limit the search to a time frame of May 1st 2024 and the date that this request is received. I believe that RCW Ch. 42.56 specifically makes these emails a public record. 

The public was urged to email Ms. Sodt. More information can be found here:
https://friendsofinscape.org/news/historic-seattle-landmarking
https://historicseattle.org/ins-building-inscape-landmark-nomination/

Thank you for the city of Seattle's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working with you on this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Pompeo Visit to Cairo
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All facturas, purchase orders, invoices, and similar documents originated by the American University in Cairo or the Department of State  (Secretary Pompeo and his team and President Francis Ricciardone and his team and executive assistant of the American University in Cairo (AUC)) intended to provide support (e.g., airfare, transport, food and hospitality, security for the event)for the visit to the American University in Cairo, Egypt on January 10, 2019 by Secretary Pompeo. Fiscal communications with or signed by Provost Ehab AbdelRahman (various spellings may be found), the controller at AUC, and Business Services of AUC are included in this request. 

Communications may have been via email (AUC's domain is @aucegypt.edu) but might have been via diplomatic pouch, State.gov email, etc.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Digital files preferred whenever possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dr Thomas DeVere Wolsey

title: Oklahoma State Department of Education - "Patriotic Displays" guidance

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Oklahoma State Department of Education - "Patriotic Displays" guidance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the guidance issued to school districts concerning "Patriotic Displays," as referenced in the August 29, 2024 press release by Ryan Walters and/or the Oklahoma State Department of Education.

2. A copy of any report submitted by any district detailing their policies regarding the display of the U.S. flag and the weekly recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

There are three primary types of users in Smartsheet, all with unique capabilities. If you’d like to create your own work and have greater access you’ll need to upgrade to a free trial or be granted Member access by a System Admin.

BUILD AUTOMATED WORKFLOWS

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Dan Lauber
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, communications, or other responsive records related to the procurement, execution, and delivery of services between City of Coral Springs and Dan Lauber.

Pursuant to Article I, section 24 of the Florida Constitution, and chapter 119, F.S., this request is to include all communications between Mr. Lauber and the City leading up to the execution of a contract (including initial outreach by the City or Mr. Lauber) and continuing to the present which pertain to the services procured and the execution of those services.
 
This also includes the executed contract, and any addendums, extensions, or other components of the agreement between Coral Springs and Mr. Lauber.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Martin Nash

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Case-Level Reimbursement Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Thanks for fulfilling our previous FOIA request. We had a brief follow up request. Specifically we are requesting case-level reimbursement records from Circuit Court, General District Court, and Combined District Court cases for 6 jurisdictions between January 2019 and December 2023. These jurisdictions are: Richmond, Chesterfield , Prince William County, Fairfax County, Virginia Beach and Loudon County. We are requesting four data points for each case- the jurisdiction, the reimbursement amount, the associated case number, and the date of reimbursement. We are not requesting defendant name, attorney name, or any address information. If possible, we would request this data be stored in a spreadsheet if the applicable database is capable of exporting to a spreadsheet.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Brandon Morrissey.

title: Smc civil rights violation /subsequent cover up (Santa Monica Community College)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Smc civil rights violation /subsequent cover up (Santa Monica Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request and demand access to ALL DOCUMENTS OR OTHERWISE MATERIALS , including the internal/ inter office reports, summaries, files and all other documents there are mentioned here or not mention here that were generated in response to the incident that took place  on 03/02/2020 in the admissions office at Santa Monica college, (which is located at 1900 Pico Blvd., Santa Monica, CA )between myself :
   ( Marley Nesta St. John SMC student ID number 878745), Santa Monica College, Santa Monica College police officers of the campus police department  any employees including  faculty or staff and/or any other persons involved or whitness to the actions that were taken by Santa Monica college employees or faculty and police officers, Including the Dean of students , student ombudsman representatives in regards to the incident or any other reference to a student, Marley Nesta St. John ID number 878745.

In addition, I request ALL concealed, removed , deleted emails and communications Mr. St. John’s Educational student email address as referenced here as : 
1) stjohn_marley_nesta@student.smc.edu 
2) stjohn_marley_nesta@smc.edu. 

It is also requested that any written report or Allegations made by anyone in regards to Mr. Marley St. John, Marley Nesta St. John (student). Including any document or file inserted into Mr. St. John’s student records in regards or related to the incident referenced in this document. 

I request a copy of all disciplinary action(s), documents, or files generated during the time period in which Marley Nesta St. John was a student at Santa Monica community College. 

It is my understanding that Santa Monica Community College is responsible for its police department and any missing documents to this case 
It is requested that Santa Monica Community college produce all police reports that were generated by and for Santa Monica College Police Department, the staff at Santa Monica College, the office of judicial affairs at Santa Monica College, the Dean of students,  including any documents or information that were circulated or otherwise made available to  employees , professors, or other faculty in regards to Marley Nesta St. John


It has been previously stated that there are no audio or video records or recordings existing in regards to this incident. Why have these important records not been retained ?
 Captain Carter did without question make his own digital recording on a device he had at his disposal at that time.   Including Captain Carters recording is of great importance. These recordings are a accurate and exhaustive evidentiary accounting of the incident which resulted I the clear violation of Mr. St. John's civil right's guaranteed under the constitution. Mr. St. John was unlawfully threatened without course or reason that would necessitate threats of violence, intimidation and persecution of an individual who was not threat to anyone.  Mr. St. John was clearly injured and wearing a cast on his broken foot.  Mr. St. John did nothing illegal whatsoever and simply recording the unnecessary and unlawful actions of Mr. Hernandez, who was in charge of the admissions department on that day. It was Mr. St. John's right to record the prejudicial way he was being trearted. Choosing to do so, in order to keep an accurate and complete record of that in which was taking place and that in which he was being subjugated to by Mr Hernandez and the Santa Monica College Police officers who were present that day.


When the officers arrived at the request of Mr. Hernandez at the admissions department officers of the College Police Department identified themselves as Mr St. John was seated Peaceably and quietly Keeping to himself.   Mr. Hernandez then stated that Mr. St. John had been disruptive and abusive.
 The Police department officers at the scene did nothing to attempt to resolve the situation or help Mr. St. John With any difficulties he may  have been having. Nor did they attempt too ascertain the validity of the accusations.


  The SMC PD responding officers did in fact, and without question made demands and ordered Mr. St. John to produce  documents to prove his United States citizenship by surrendering  his passport for inspection, which is governed by United Nations charter and is only applicable to be demanded and or seized At international borders or inspection areas that have been previously established well marked, and those subject to such demands Had willingly done so by entering into these border areas.  These protocols were not followed and without any lawful reason or investigative necessity did in fact make threats of being arrested and trespassed from the school indefinitely and spending time in Santa Monica jail if he did not surrender his, protected documents and sensitive personal records contained in his passport. He attempted to explain to officers involved that what they were doing, was in fact, illegal and unconstitutional, and they had absolutely no right whatsoever or reason or investigative purpose to demand under the color of law his documents and passport from Mr. St. John.

When Mr. St. John refused, the officers physically assaulted Mr. St. John by violently and forcefully pushing his face to include the upper half of his torso and his shoulders, arms and hands forward onto the table in which she sat thereby detaining and arresting Mr. St. John at that moment, they then forcefully removed St. John’s documents, unlawfully,  violating his civil rights assaulting him committing theft of a government document that they were not entitled to receive from Mr. St. John with the implied threat of more violence. Should he in any way shape or form verbally resist any further or physically attempt to maintain possession of his personal documents . After the violent and illegal theft of property , Assault and battery, Invasion of privacy intimidation as well violations of his civil rights officers and Mr. Hernandez did in fact take photocopies of Mr. St. Johns passport inspecting every page and the v visas contained therein.
 
While remaining seated Mr. St. John explained to the officers that they had no right to do what they did , having done so at the direction of Mr. Hernandez did not justify their actions.  He has absolutely no power to request them to do anything like that.  Mr. St. John.  Mr. St. John was obviously injured, and in a cast of his leg to be very obvious that Mr. St. John was in no condition act in a violent manner nor display any threats or postures of violence towards anyone whatsoever he was seated at the time with his hands in plain sight.

For having such an incident take place it is not creditable that there were no video preserved from the security cameras or any reports made other than the one single report that was provided. Multiple officers were present but only one made a report?


Please be certain to provide all of the information requested or I will seek a court order to compel you to do so.



         Sincerely,


                   

               Marley Nesta St. John

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marley St. John

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Fraudulent Vaccine documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I'm requesting each and every investigation into fraudulent vaccine documentation. I'd request each and ever email in the SFD that mentions any reference to fake or fraudulent vaccine documentation. 
How many people were disciplined for fraudulent vaccine documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Steven J Collins

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Dana Stidham Cold Case File
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records, documents, photographs, and video and audio recordings related to the disappearance and murder of Dana Stidham.
All audio and video recordings and associated transcripts of interviews with Mike McMillan.
All audio and video recordings and associated transcripts of interviews with other witnesses, Dana Stidham's family and friends, and persons of interest.
A listing of categorized evidence along with photographs.
All photographs, both interior and exterior, and documentation of Dana Stidham's car.
All photographs and documentation of Dana Stidham's body and its location, including but not limited to aerial photos, scene sketches and evidence collected at the scene.
All autopsy and forensic reports on Dana Stidham's body.
All lab reports, including but not limited to hair analysis and DNA testing thereof, if any, and any other forensic files. 
All search warrants or affidavits filed in connection with Dana Stidham's case.
All communications logs including but not limited to phone records and dispatch logs.
All police records regarding the Dana Stidham case, including but not limited to incident reports, supplementary reports and detective notes.
All photography and video and audio recordings taken by non-police persons included in the case file.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Christian Monson.

communications.subject: DoD OIG FOIA Request DODOIG-2024-000715
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Mills:

This correspondence pertains to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for "report Evaluation of Combatant Command Joint Military Deception Planning (Report No. DODIG-2024-085) and any associated drafts, memorandum which go to the initial request for this report or the process of generating this report."  We received your request on August 26, 2024, and assigned it case number DODOIG-2024-000715.

As currently worded, your request is not sufficiently described for our office to conduct a search.  We will need clarification on the second portion of your records description in order to process your request.  We are not sure which records you are referring to when you state "memorandum which go to the initial request for this report or the process of generating this report."

The FOIA requires federal agencies to provide records that are reasonably described.  Please note that a record is not reasonably described unless the description contains sufficient information to enable a professional agency employee familiar with the subject area to locate the records with a reasonable amount of effort.  We will hold your request open for 30 calendar days from the date of this correspondence, pending receipt of a more clearly described request for records.

You may contact our FOIA Public Liaison at FOIAPublicLiaison@dodig.mil<mailto:FOIAPublicLiaison@dodig.mil>, or by calling 703-604-9785, for any further assistance with your request.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, MD 20740-6001, email at ogis@nara.gov<mailto:ogis@nara.gov>; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

If you have any questions regarding this matter, please contact the DoD OIG FOIA Requester Service Center at 703-604-9775 or via email at foiarequests@dodig.mil<mailto:foiarequests@dodig.mil>.

Sincerely,
FOIA Requester Service Center
Office of Inspector General
Department of Defense

P. 703-604-9775
F. 571-372-7498
E. foiarequests@dodig.mil<mailto:foiarequests@dodig.mil>

This e-mail is from the Department of Defense Office of Inspector General {DoD OIG}. It may contain Controlled Unclassified Information {CUI}, including information that is Law Enforcement Sensitive {LES}, subject to the Privacy Act, and/or other privileges and restrictions that prohibit release without appropriate legal authority. Do not disseminate without the approval of the DoD OIG.  If received in error, please notify the sender by reply e-mail and delete all copies of this message.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #DODOIG-2024-000715
communications.communication:
Thanks for your quick response. I will reduce it to just the actual report. Evaluation of Combatant Command Joint Military Deception Planning (Report No. DODIG-2024-085) .

Best,
Brian

title: Immanuel Lewis - Kleberg County Bodycam Footage

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Immanuel Lewis - Kleberg County Bodycam Footage
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to a traffic stop that occurred on July 31, 2024, at approximately 7:30 PM. The details of the incident are as follows:

	•	Driver’s Name: Immanuel Lewis
	•	Date of Incident: July 31, 2024
	•	Time of Incident: Approximately 7:30 PM
	•	Location of Traffic Stop: [Include the exact location if known, e.g., “Highway 123, near Exit 45”]
	•	Violation Number: 24.007054
	•	Officer ID Numbers: 167
	•	Ticket Number: 025072
	•	Primary Officers Involved: [If known, include names; if unknown, state “Requesting footage from both primary officers involved”]

I request the following:

	1.	Bodycam footage from both primary officers who conducted the traffic stop.
	2.	Any related dashcam footage if available.
	3.	Any audio recordings or transcripts related to this traffic stop.

If the requested information cannot be provided in its entirety, please provide any accessible portions of the records, and inform me of the reasons for the denial of any part of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Immanuel Lewis

title: Michael Gill Sr's Evidence to Attorney Andrew Lelling (United States Attorney's Office for the District of Massachusetts)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Michael Gill Sr's Evidence to Attorney Andrew Lelling (United States Attorney's Office for the District of Massachusetts)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Michael Gill Sr of 69 Conleys Grove Road, Derry, New Hampshire sent three folders of evidence to US Attorney Andrew Lelling dated June 17 and postmarked July 18 2018. Confirmation of receipt by Andrew Lelling was sent on July 30, 2018.

Firstly I request that the US Attorney's Office confirm that everything listed on that receipt is still in their possession, secondly I request electronic copies, preferably in PDF format, of as much as possible of the three folders of evidence (disregard the electronic evidence, just the paper evidence) described in the sending cover letter:
1) Morris Mahoney and Liberty Mutual et cetera
2) IRS Boston office et cetera
3) Drug cartel activity et cetera

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Patrick Mockridge

communications.communication:
Dear Mr Krebs,

The three folders were sent as part of the same evidence package, I have specified the package, specified the receipt. Links to the receipt and the cover letter itself can be found on the blockchain here:
The receipt letter from Attorney Andrew Lelling is attached.

That information corroborates the dates.

The cover letter can be found here
Page 1: https://arweave.net/RH6dzdYRQZwqUL2n2-fSNgpQwr8q8iUvNXNNV94x5RE

Basic competence and basic organisational responsibility are not the burden of the requester, they are your burden.

Yours Sincerely

Patrick Mockridge

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #EOUSA-2024-003101
communications.communication:
Dear Mr Krebs,

Please find your form request completed below, with annotations pertaining to my previous communication, mainly that three folders that arrived to you in one piece should still be in one piece if you are storing evidence as your are legally required to, and that three folders do not take two hours to find if you are storing and indexing evidence as you are legally required to.

If you disagree you are free to explain why, otherwise I am happy to allow an additional $100 for duplication costs of said three folders of evidence that should each be marked on a shelf with a reference ID according to general best practices, as I am sure they are under your wise and learned supervision.

Your Sincerely

Patrick Mockridge

title: Michael Gill Sr's Evidence to Attorney Andrew Lelling (Attorney General's Office)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Michael Gill Sr's Evidence to Attorney Andrew Lelling (Attorney General's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Michael Gill Sr of 69 Conleys Grove Road, Derry, New Hampshire sent three folders of evidence to US Attorney Andrew Lelling dated June 17 and postmarked July 18 2018. Confirmation of receipt by Andrew Lelling was sent on July 30, 2018.

Firstly I request that the US Attorney's Office confirm that everything listed on that receipt is still in their possession, secondly I request electronic copies, preferably in PDF format, of as much as possible of the three folders of evidence (disregard the electronic evidence, just the paper evidence) described in the sending cover letter:
1) Morris Mahoney and Liberty Mutual et cetera
2) IRS Boston office et cetera
3) Drug cartel activity et cetera

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Patrick Mockridge

communications.subject: Records Request submitted to the Massachusetts Attorney General’s Office

Thank you for submitting your Records Request to the Attorney General's Office. 



Please remember:  If you submit a request on a weekend or legal holiday it will be received the next business day; otherwise your request is received on the day you submit it.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Diplomatic Intercepts - Italy Misc.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

File 65-HQ-40178, on the interception of diplomatic communications from the Italian government during World War II.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante
